metadata.Title: CVE-2021-36367 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: PuTTY through 0.75 proceeds with establishing an SSH session even if it has never sent a substantive authentication response. This makes it easier for an attacker-controlled SSH server to present a later spoofed authentication prompt (that the attacker can use to capture credential data, and use that data for purposes that are undesired by the client user).

criterions.comment: putty: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
